content:
Course Notes - CS 165 - Project in Algorithms and Data Structures

The following documents outline the notes for the course CS 165 Project in Algorithms and Data Structures.

Note: Some of the notes are in PDF format. Viewing these files requires the use of a PDF Reader.

Notes by Lecture Schedule

  • Week 1: Introduction. Algorithm Analysis. Select Sorting Algorithms.
    • Algorithm Analysis (Powerpoint)
    • Wikipedia article on Big-Oh notation
    • Select Sorting Algorithms (Powerpoint)
    • Obama's Answer to the Sorting Question
    • Wikipedia article on Bubble sort
    • Wikipedia article on Insertion sort
    • Wikipedia article on Shellsort
  • Week 2: Random Numbers and Random Permutations.
    • Random and Pseudo-Random Numbers (Powerpoint)
    • Random Permutations (Powerpoint)
    • Wikipedia article on Random number generators
    • Wikipedia article on Hardware random number generators
    • Wikipedia article on Pseudorandom number generators
    • Wikipedia article on the Mersenne Twister PRNG
    • Wikipedia article on Fisher-Yates random shuffle algorithm
  • Week 3: Greedy method, approximation algorithms, bin packing.
    • The Greedy Method
    • Bin Packing (Powerpoint)
    • Optional reading: Approximation Algorithms for Bin Packing
  • Week 4: Experimental algorithm analysis.
    • Wikipedia article about log-log plots (focus especially on "Relation with monomials")
    • A Theoretician's Guide to the Experimental Analysis of Algorithms, by David Johnson
    • Project 1 due
  • Week 5: Network structure.
    • Network Structure (Powerpoint)
    • Kevin Bacon Visa commercial illustrating six degrees-of-separation
    • Wikipedia article on degree distribution
    • Wikipedia article on diameter
    • Wikipedia article on clustering coefficient
  • Week 6: Network algorithms.
    • Network Algorithms (Powerpoint)
    • Wikipedia article about semi-log plots, e.g., note how the log x function looks like a straight line in a lin-log plot.
    • Wikipedia article on breadth-first search
    • Wikipedia article on graph degeneracy
  • Week 7: Review of bin-packing algorithms.
    • Wikipedia article on the bin-packing problem
    • Project 2 due
  • Week 8: Network models.
    • Network Models (Powerpoint)
    • Wikipedia article on the Erdős–Rényi model
    • Wikipedia article on the Barabási–Albert model.
    • Efficient generation of large random networks, by Batagelj and Brandes.
  • Week 9: Navigation and propagation in networks.
    • Navigation and propagation in networks (Powerpoint)
    • Wikipedia article on network hubs
    • Wikipedia article on Kleinberg's model
    • Wikipedia article on PageRank
  • Week 10: Review of network algorithms.
    • Wikipedia article on scale-free networks
    • Project 3 due


Michael T. Goodrich
Department of Computer Science
University of California, Irvine, CA 92697-3435 USA
